Nature exploration, hands-on learning, and skill sharing

About

Mission

Waterbear Field School is an outdoor educational program focused on nature exploration, hands-on learning, and skill sharing for kids and adults.

Core Activities

Nature exploration Hiking local trails Wildlife observation Hands-on project building STEM learning Local history research Arts and crafts Music making Electronics Radio Maps Shelter making

What we do

  • Explore nature together — hiking local trails, observing wildlife, and learning to read the landscape
  • Build useful things — creating practical projects for homes, gardens, and community spaces
  • Learn STEM — focusing on measuring, designing, testing, and iterating through hands-on experiments
  • Learn local history — researching our area's past and sharing stories through creative projects
  • Make art & music — crafting instruments, creating art from natural materials, and enjoying outdoor sessions

Example Projects

Cold frames & hoop houses Rainwater capture systems Garden carts DIY farm tools Sewing projects Musical instrument creation Low-power radio experiments Small-scale solar power

Location

Greater Boston area in Massachusetts, USA, with networked locations beyond.

Contact

Email: info@waterbearfieldschool.org
